question: Carl places cookies on some baskets. Each basket can hold 36 cookies. If he has 206 cookies and 3 baskets, how many cookies won't he be able to place on the basket?
answer:
Carl will be able to place a total of 36*3 = <<36*3=108>>108 cookies.
Therefore, there are 206 - 108 = <<206-108=98>>98 cookies that he won't be able to place on the basket.
#### 98
